ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Thinking of all the times you used marijuana how often would you say that you used marijuana for the following reasons: To forget your worries
Notes: 1=Almost never/never; 2=Some of the time; 3=Half of the time; 4=Most of the time; 5=Almost always/always

ElementDescription: Marijuana Motives Measure (MMM): Coping Motives Subscale
Notes: Mean of items marijuanamotive01, marijuanamotive04, marijuanamotive06, marijuanamotive15, marijuanamotive17

ElementDescription: Marijuana Motives Measure (MMM): Conformity Motives
Notes: Mean of items marijuanamotive02, marijuanamotive08, marijuanamotive12, marijuanamotive19, marijuanamotive20

ElementDescription: Marijuana Motives Measure (MMM): Social Motives Subscale
Notes: Mean of items marijuanamotive03, marijuanamotive05, marijuanamotive11, marijuanamotive14, marijuanamotive16

ElementDescription: Marijuana Motives Measure (MMM): Enhancement Motives Subscale
Notes: Mean of items marijuanamotive07, marijuanamotive09, marijuanamotive10, marijuanamotive13, marijuanamotive18

ElementDescription: Marijuana Motives Measure (MMM): Expansion Motives Subscale
Notes: Mean of items marijuanamotive21, marijuanamotive22, marijuanamotive23, marijuanamotive24, marijuanamotive25

ElementDescription: Marijuana Motives Measure (MMM): Total Score Subscale
Notes: Sum of means for the five subscales
